episodeTitle: Making a Sortie! The Legendary Hero Usoland!
description: Usopp and Robin arrive at the Tontatta Kingdom beneath Green Bit, where Gancho reveals the dwarves' 900-year history with the Donquixote Family. The dwarves prepare for battle to rescue their captured comrades. Meanwhile, Law faces Doflamingo at Green Bit, Luffy continues his fight with Don Chinjao at the Colosseum, and Giolla attacks the Thousand Sunny with her art-transforming Devil Fruit powers.

events.title: Gancho's First Appearance
events.description: Gancho, the king of the Tontatta Kingdom (also called Tonta-Chief), emerges from Robin's clothes and greets Usopp and Robin. He is distinguished from other dwarves by his long beard and lack of a pointy nose.
events.significance: Introduces the leader of the Tontatta tribe who will play a crucial role in organizing the rebellion against Doflamingo.

events.title: 900-Year History Between Dwarves and Donquixote Family Revealed
events.description: Gancho reveals that the conflict between the Tontatta tribe and the Donquixote Family didn't start ten years ago with Doflamingo's takeover, but actually dates back 900 years to the Void Century. The Tontatta were exploited and enslaved by the original King Donquixote, bringing the darkest period to their tribe.
events.significance: Connects the Dressrosa conflict to the Void Century and reveals the deep historical roots of the struggle, paralleling the story of Alabasta and suggesting the Donquixote family's connection to the World Nobles.

quotes.text: The history between the dwarves and the Donquixote Family started not ten years ago, but dates back even to 900 years ago.
quotes.speaker: Gancho
quotes.context: Gancho explaining the true depth of the conflict to Usopp and Robin

events.title: Tontatta Airline Revealed
events.description: Leo brings Usopp and Robin to the Tontatta Kingdom's airport, called Tontatta Airline (TAL), which features rideable insects and animals as transport. This underground transportation system connects Green Bit to Dressrosa.
events.significance: Reveals the dwarves' unique infrastructure and their secret route to infiltrate Dressrosa for their rebellion.

quotes.text: There's a subterranean way that connects Green Bit and Dressrosa which we would use as our way of transportation.
quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.context: Leo explaining the secret passage to Usopp

events.title: Kabu's Devil Fruit Revealed
events.description: Kabu, the Yellow Kabu Squad Leader, reveals his Mushi Mushi no Mi, Model: Kabutomushi (Bug-Bug Fruit, Model: Rhinoceros Beetle) by transforming into his hybrid form. This Zoan-type Devil Fruit allows him to transform into a rhinoceros beetle and fly.
events.significance: First display of a dwarf with Devil Fruit powers and reveals the dwarves' combat capabilities for the upcoming battle.

events.title: Bian's Devil Fruit Revealed
events.description: Bian, the Pink Bee Squad Leader, reveals her Mushi Mushi no Mi, Model: Suzumebachi (Bug-Bug Fruit, Model: Hornet) which allows her to transform into a hornet. She demonstrates this ability in preparation for transporting Usopp and Robin.
events.significance: Further demonstrates the Tontatta tribe's combat strength and reveals that multiple dwarves possess Devil Fruit abilities.

events.title: Usopp Recognized as Legendary Hero Usoland
events.description: The dwarves celebrate the arrival of the legendary heroes 'Robiland' and 'Usoland.' Leo shouts that with the great Usoland by their side, they shall rescue their fellow dwarves. The dwarves have complete faith in Usopp as their prophesied hero.
events.significance: Establishes Usopp's crucial role as the inspirational figure for the Tontatta rebellion, setting up his character development and the burden of living up to their expectations.

quotes.text: With the great Usoland by our side, we shall rescue our fellow dwarves!
quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.context: Leo rallying the dwarves with confidence in Usopp

events.title: Thunder Soldier and Franky Meet the Dwarf Army
events.description: Beneath a field of sunflowers in Dressrosa lies the Riku Royal Army (also called the Anti-Doflamingo Army) led by the Thunder Soldier. Thunder Soldier introduces Franky to his brothers-in-arms, the dwarves, who see Franky as a strong-looking toy and valuable ally for the coming war.
events.significance: Reveals the alliance between the Thunder Soldier, Franky, and the dwarves, establishing the rebellion's forces against Doflamingo.

quotes.text: The dwarves' strength won't lose to yours, and with their blinding speed, they are known by the Dressrosa citizens as fairies.
quotes.speaker: Thunder Soldier
quotes.context: Thunder Soldier explaining the dwarves' abilities to Franky

events.title: Doflamingo Confronts Law at Green Bit
events.description: On Green Bit's surface, Doflamingo appears and confronts a tired Law. Doflamingo cuts numerous stones with his string powers and demands that Law return Caesar's heart. He reveals that Luffy fell into his trap at the tournament filled with the strongest outlaws.
events.significance: Escalates the conflict between Law and Doflamingo, revealing Doflamingo's manipulation of the situation and putting Law in immediate danger.

quotes.text: Luffy is having a lot of fun in the tournament full with the strongest people - mainly outlaws - but the ones who lose in it will fall straight to hell and will never make it out of the tournament.
quotes.speaker: Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo revealing his trap to Law

events.title: Giolla Attacks the Thousand Sunny
events.description: Giolla uses her Ato Ato no Mi (Art-Art Fruit) powers to assault the Thousand Sunny, transforming Nami, Chopper, Brook, Momonosuke, and parts of the ship into abstract forms of art. Nami finds herself clearly on the losing side against this bizarre ability.
events.significance: Creates a crisis on the Sunny with most of the crew transformed, threatening their ability to escape and forcing the characters to find creative solutions.

events.title: Ato Ato no Mi Powers Demonstrated
events.description: Giolla reveals she ate the Ato Ato no Mi, making her an Art Human. She demonstrates her ability to turn objects and people into works of art by throwing colored clouds. Nami's Clima-Tact is transformed into a useless art piece, Chopper's horns become wings and his hooves become rabbits, and Brook's Soul Solid is transformed.
events.significance: Reveals the full extent of Giolla's Devil Fruit abilities and how it renders the Straw Hats' weapons and abilities useless.

events.title: Luffy vs Don Chinjao Continues
events.description: At the Corrida Colosseum, Luffy (as Lucy) continues his intense battle with Don Chinjao in Block C. Their clash demonstrates both fighters' Armament Haki abilities as they trade powerful blows.
events.significance: Continues one of the major fights of the Dressrosa arc and demonstrates Luffy's growth in Haki mastery against a legendary pirate.

events.title: Jesus Burgess Approaches Bartolomeo and Cavendish
events.description: At the Corrida Colosseum, Jesus Burgess, a member of the Blackbeard Pirates, approaches Bartolomeo and Cavendish, wondering who 'the little runt' is. This interaction hints at the dangerous competitors gathered at the tournament.
events.significance: Foreshadows future conflicts and emphasizes the high caliber of fighters assembled at the Colosseum, including a member of a Yonko's crew.

events.title: Dwarves Prepare for Operation SOP
events.description: The dwarves of the Tontatta Kingdom prepare to sortie and begin Operation SOP to rescue their 500 captured comrades from the Donquixote Family. They organize their forces and ready themselves for the dangerous mission ahead.
events.significance: Sets up the major operation that will drive much of the Dressrosa arc's action and the dwarves' role in the rebellion.

quotes.text: The history between the dwarves and the Donquixote Family started not ten years ago, but dates back even to 900 years ago.
quotes.speaker: Gancho
quotes.context: Revealing the true depth of the Tontatta-Donquixote conflict

quotes.text: With the great Usoland by our side, we shall rescue our fellow dwarves!
quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.context: Rallying the dwarves with faith in Usopp

quotes.text: Luffy is having a lot of fun in the tournament full with the strongest people - mainly outlaws - but the ones who lose in it will fall straight to hell and will never make it out of the tournament.
quotes.speaker: Doflamingo

quotes.text: There's a subterranean way that connects Green Bit and Dressrosa which we would use as our way of transportation.
quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.context: Explaining the secret passage to Usopp

themes.description: The episode reveals that the conflict in Dressrosa is not recent but part of a 900-year cycle of exploitation dating back to the Void Century, paralleling real-world patterns of generational trauma and systemic oppression.
themes.symbolism: The underground kingdom of the Tontatta represents how oppressed peoples are forced to hide and organize in secret, while the sunflower field above conceals the rebellion brewing below.
culturalReferences: The 900-year history connects to the broader One Piece mythology of the Void Century and World Government's formation, suggesting the Donquixote family's role in ancient atrocities.

themes.description: Usopp is hailed as a legendary hero despite his insecurities, creating tension between the expectations placed on him and his self-perceived cowardice. This explores how heroes are made and the burden of living up to others' faith.
themes.symbolism: The title 'Usoland' represents both a lie (Usopp's usual tendency) and a truth (his potential for genuine heroism when others believe in him).

themes.description: Giolla's Art-Art Fruit powers literalize the concept of art as a tool of control and distortion, transforming functional objects and people into useless 'art' pieces.
themes.symbolism: The transformation of the Straw Hats and their weapons into abstract art represents the corruption and dysfunction that Doflamingo's regime brings to everything it touches.

themes.description: The episode juggles multiple concurrent conflicts across different locations, emphasizing the complexity of the Dressrosa situation and how the Straw Hats are spread thin and vulnerable.
themes.symbolism: The geographical separation of the crew across the Sunny, Colosseum, Green Bit, and underground symbolizes their vulnerability when divided.

characterSpotlights.role: Reluctant hero figure for the Tontatta rebellion
characterSpotlights.development: Usopp finds himself burdened with the expectations of an entire tribe who see him as their legendary savior, creating internal conflict between his cowardice and their unwavering faith.
keyActions: Arrives at the Tontatta Kingdom with Robin
Is celebrated as the legendary hero Usoland
Witnesses the dwarves' preparations for battle
quotes: With the great Usoland by our side, we shall rescue our fellow dwarves!

characterSpotlights.role: King of the Tontatta Kingdom and keeper of history
characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as the wise leader who reveals the deep historical roots of the conflict and organizes the rebellion against Doflamingo.
keyActions: Emerges from Robin's clothes to greet the heroes
Reveals the 900-year history with the Donquixote Family
Organizes the Tontatta forces for Operation SOP
quotes: The history between the dwarves and the Donquixote Family started not ten years ago, but dates back even to 900 years ago.

characterSpotlights.development: Doflamingo demonstrates his calculating nature by revealing his multi-layered trap and confronting Law while maintaining control over multiple situations simultaneously.
keyActions: Reveals that Luffy fell into his Colosseum trap
quotes: Luffy is having a lot of fun in the tournament full with the strongest people - mainly outlaws - but the ones who lose in it will fall straight to hell and will never make it out of the tournament.

characterSpotlights.role: Defender of the Thousand Sunny under siege
characterSpotlights.development: Nami struggles against Giolla's bizarre art powers, finding her usual combat abilities rendered useless when her weapons are transformed.
keyActions: Attempts to fight Giolla on the Sunny
Has her Clima-Tact transformed into useless art
Witnesses the transformation of her crewmates

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some of the fight scenes at the Corrida Colosseum for pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode primarily adapts Chapter 718 of the manga, titled 'Riku Royal Army on the Flower Hill.'
The episode aired on June 8, 2014 in Japan during the height of the Dressrosa arc's popularity.
The Mushi Mushi no Mi fruits revealed in this episode are both Zoan-type Devil Fruits of the insect variety, a relatively rare class in One Piece.
The 900-year history revelation connects Dressrosa to the Void Century, making it one of the few locations with confirmed ties to that mysterious period.
Shigefumi Shingaki served as animation director for this episode, bringing his distinctive style to the Dressrosa arc.
The opening theme 'Wake up!' by AAA was used for episodes 629-686, covering the majority of the Dressrosa arc.
